organization.fullName: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

identificationModule.briefTitle: Intra-arterial Neuroprotective Strategy for Ischemic STroke Patients With No Reperfusion Therapy (INSIST-NRT)
identificationModule.officialTitle: Intra-arterial Neuroprotective Strategy for Ischemic STroke Patients With No Reperfusion Therapy (INSIST-NRT): One Single Center, Safety and Feasibility Study

responsibleParty.investigatorAffiliation: General Hospital of Shenyang Military Region

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To explore the safety and feasibility of intra-arterial neuroprotective strategy in acute ischemic stroke patients who missed recanalization operation.

armGroups.label: Intra-arterial administration of 3-n-butylphthalide
armGroups.description: Intra-arterial administration of 3-n-butylphthalide for 24 hours via microcatheter at 17.36 ug/min.
interventionNames: Drug: Intra-arterial administration of neuroprotective agents

interventions.name: Intra-arterial administration of neuroprotective agents
interventions.description: Intra-arterial administration of 3-n-butylphthalide for 24 hours via microcatheter at 17.36 ug/min.

primaryOutcomes.description: server adverse events including femoral artery dissection, local thrombosis, seudoaneurysm, arteriovenousfistula, etc.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 1
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 1

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 2
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Score 0 to 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Decrease in national institutes of health stroke scale (NIHSS)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Decrease in NIHSS scoring at 48 hours after the treatment
sICH was defined as 4 or more increase in NIHSS caused by hemorrhage

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of intraparenchymal hemorrhage (PH1 and PH2)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of intraparenchymal hemorrhage (PH1 and PH2) within 48 hours after the treatment
Cerebral edema was determined by cerebral volume or midline shift

secondaryOutcomes.measure: All causes of death within 48 hours after the treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: All causes of death within 48 hours after the treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Differences in serum factors levels in different artery region
secondaryOutcomes.description: Differences in serum factors levels in different Bessel region before recanalization

locations.facility: Department of Neurology, General Hospital of Northern Theater Command
